20110114030009.000|20110114030011.000|TR0|360.  Thanks for watching.
20110114030011.000|20110114030013.000|TR0|
20110114030013.000|20110114030016.000|TR0|Tonight, "Keeping Them Honest": the missed 
20110114030016.000|20110114030018.000|TR0|opportunities that might have prevented a 
20110114030018.000|20110114030020.000|TR0|massacre.  Did campus officials at the 
20110114030020.000|20110114030022.000|TR0|community college that Jared Loughner 
20110114030022.000|20110114030025.000|TR0|attended know that the Arizona law would 
20110114030025.000|20110114030027.000|TR0|have allowed them or anyone to contact 
20110114030027.000|20110114030029.000|TR0|mental health professionals regarding 
20110114030029.000|20110114030031.000|TR0|Loughner?
20110114030031.000|20110114030034.000|TR0|
20110114030034.000|20110114030036.000|TR0|Under Arizona law, it's a lot easier to 
20110114030036.000|20110114030038.000|TR0|have someone evaluated, but did school 
20110114030038.000|20110114030040.000|TR0|officials know that?  Would it have made a 
20110114030040.000|20110114030043.000|TR0|difference?
20110114030043.000|20110114030045.000|TR0|
20110114030045.000|20110114030047.000|TR0|Also tonight: witnessing a miracle.  
20110114030047.000|20110114030049.000|TR0|That's how doctors are describing 
20110114030049.000|20110114030052.000|TR0|Congresswoman Giffords' recovery.  We will 
20110114030052.000|20110114030054.000|TR0|update you on that and talk to Sanjay 
20110114030054.000|20110114030056.000|TR0|Gupta, who spoke exclusively with her 
20110114030056.000|20110114030058.000|TR0|husband and fellow survivors.

20110114030105.000|20110114030107.000|TR0|a gun the answer for lawmakers on Capitol 
20110114030107.000|20110114030110.000|TR0|Hill?  We will talk to one congressman who 
20110114030110.000|20110114030112.000|TR0|sometimes packs heat.
20110114030112.000|20110114030114.000|TR0|
20110114030114.000|20110114030116.000|TR0|We begin tonight, though, with something 
20110114030116.000|20110114030119.000|TR0|no parent should ever have to do.
20110114030119.000|20110114030121.000|TR0|
20110114030121.000|20110114030123.000|TR0|Today, John and Roxanna Green attended her 
20110114030123.000|20110114030125.000|TR0|funeral mass. Christina Green was just 9 
20110114030125.000|20110114030128.000|TR0|years old.  Her parents and brother Dallas 
20110114030128.000|20110114030130.000|TR0|were comforted by family, friends and 
20110114030130.000|20110114030132.000|TR0|Christina's classmates.  Our thoughts and 
20110114030132.000|20110114030134.000|TR0|our prayers are with them all.
20110114030134.000|20110114030137.000|TR0|
20110114030137.000|20110114030139.000|TR0|There was good news today to report as 
20110114030139.000|20110114030141.000|TR0|well.  The woman Christina had gone to 
20110114030141.000|20110114030143.000|TR0|meet on Saturday, Congresswoman Giffords, 
20110114030143.000|20110114030146.000|TR0|continued her remarkable recovery.  She is 
20110114030146.000|20110114030148.000|TR0|now aware of her environment, her doctors 
20110114030148.000|20110114030150.000|TR0|say, and is trying to engage in it.  As we 
20110114030150.000|20110114030152.000|TR0|said, Sanjay has got much more from the 
20110114030152.000|20110114030155.000|TR0|hospital shortly, exclusive details 
20110114030155.000|20110114030157.000|TR0|directly from her husband.
20110114030157.000|20110114030159.000|TR0|
20110114030159.000|20110114030201.000|TR0|As for the suspect, Jared Loughner, police 
20110114030201.000|20110114030204.000|TR0|recovered a bag containing several boxes 
20110114030204.000|20110114030206.000|TR0|of ammunition that they say matches the 
20110114030206.000|20110114030208.000|TR0|type used in the shootings.  The FBI now 
20110114030208.000|20110114030210.000|TR0|has that bag.  It was located in a dry 
20110114030210.000|20110114030213.000|TR0|riverbed.  Loughner's father says he 
20110114030213.000|20110114030215.000|TR0|confronted him about the bag the morning 
20110114030215.000|20110114030217.000|TR0|of shooting, asked him what it was, what 
20110114030217.000|20110114030219.000|TR0|he was doing with it, got no clear answer 
20110114030219.000|20110114030222.000|TR0|from his son.
20110114030222.000|20110114030224.000|TR0|
20110114030224.000|20110114030226.000|TR0|Details on all of that tonight, but we 
20110114030226.000|20110114030228.000|TR0|begin "Keeping Them Honest" with some 
20110114030228.000|20110114030231.000|TR0|tough questions about whether Loughner's 
20110114030231.000|20110114030233.000|TR0|school dropped the ball.  Today, Pima 
20110114030233.000|20110114030235.000|TR0|Community College released records showing 
20110114030235.000|20110114030237.000|TR0|incident after incident of Loughner's 
20110114030237.000|20110114030240.000|TR0|bizarre and troubling behavior, troubling 
20110114030240.000|20110114030242.000|TR0|enough to bring campus police into the 
20110114030242.000|20110114030244.000|TR0|picture and eventually get Loughner 
20110114030244.000|20110114030247.000|TR0|suspended.
20110114030247.000|20110114030249.000|TR0|
20110114030249.000|20110114030251.000|TR0|The question is, why did his behavior not 
20110114030251.000|20110114030253.000|TR0|get Loughner into the county mental health 
20110114030253.000|20110114030256.000|TR0|system or even on their radar?
20110114030256.000|20110114030258.000|TR0|
20110114030258.000|20110114030300.000|TR0|Well, here's the latest that we learned 
20110114030300.000|20110114030302.000|TR0|today.  February 2, 2010, the dean calls 
20110114030302.000|20110114030305.000|TR0|campus police to report strange behavior 
20110114030305.000|20110114030307.000|TR0|in class, Loughner reportedly reacting 
20110114030307.000|20110114030309.000|TR0|strangely to a classmate's poem, making 
20110114030309.000|20110114030311.000|TR0|comments about abortion, wars, killing, 
20110114030311.000|20110114030314.000|TR0|and asking, according to the teacher -- 
20110114030314.000|20110114030316.000|TR0|quote -- "Why don't we just strap bombs to 
20110114030316.000|20110114030318.000|TR0|babies?"
20110114030318.000|20110114030320.000|TR0|
20110114030320.000|20110114030323.000|TR0|Campus police decide the remarks didn't 
20110114030323.000|20110114030325.000|TR0|justify their making contact with 
20110114030325.000|20110114030327.000|TR0|Loughner.  Two months later, April 10, 
20110114030327.000|20110114030329.000|TR0|campus police are called to the library.  
20110114030329.000|20110114030332.000|TR0|Loughner was listening to music on ear -- 
20110114030332.000|20110114030334.000|TR0|earphones and making loud noises.  They 
20110114030334.000|20110114030336.000|TR0|told him it wasn't appropriate behavior.  
20110114030336.000|20110114030338.000|TR0|He promised it wouldn't happen again.
20110114030338.000|20110114030341.000|TR0|
20110114030341.000|20110114030343.000|TR0|May 17, a college instructor reports a 
20110114030343.000|20110114030345.000|TR0|confrontation over a B grade she gave him. 
20110114030345.000|20110114030347.000|TR0| He became -- quote -- "very hostile," she 
20110114030347.000|20110114030350.000|TR0|says. She says she feared the 
20110114030350.000|20110114030352.000|TR0|confrontation might become physical.  The 
20110114030352.000|20110114030354.000|TR0|supervisor also reportedly felt 
20110114030354.000|20110114030356.000|TR0|intimidated.  The instructor told police 
20110114030356.000|20110114030359.000|TR0|she didn't feel comfortable teaching 
20110114030359.000|20110114030401.000|TR0|Loughner without an officer in the area.
20110114030401.000|20110114030403.000|TR0|
20110114030403.000|20110114030405.000|TR0|A few weeks later, June 1, Loughner was 
20110114030405.000|20110114030408.000|TR0|allegedly disrupting his math class, the 
20110114030408.000|20110114030410.000|TR0|report stating, "The instructor and 
20110114030410.000|20110114030412.000|TR0|students in the class are uncomfortable 
20110114030412.000|20110114030414.000|TR0|with Loughner inside their class and are 
20110114030414.000|20110114030417.000|TR0|afraid of any repercussions that could 
20110114030417.000|20110114030419.000|TR0|exist from Loughner being unstable in his 
20110114030419.000|20110114030421.000|TR0|actions."
20110114030421.000|20110114030423.000|TR0|
20110114030423.000|20110114030426.000|TR0|On September 13, campus police were 
20110114030426.000|20110114030428.000|TR0|dispatched when Loughner and a teacher 
20110114030428.000|20110114030430.000|TR0|reportedly quarreled again.  It was over a 
20110114030430.000|20110114030432.000|TR0|grade.
20110114030432.000|20110114030435.000|TR0|
20110114030435.000|20110114030437.000|TR0|According to the police: "I noticed during 
20110114030437.000|20110114030439.000|TR0|my question that Loughner's head was 
20110114030439.000|20110114030441.000|TR0|constantly tilted to the left and his eyes 
20110114030441.000|20110114030444.000|TR0|were jittery and looking up to the left."
20110114030444.000|20110114030446.000|TR0|
20110114030446.000|20110114030448.000|TR0|On the 29th, campus police served a 
20110114030448.000|20110114030450.000|TR0|suspension letter on Loughner and says he 
20110114030450.000|20110114030453.000|TR0|appeared to be staring as if in a trance.  
20110114030453.000|20110114030455.000|TR0|The same day, they alerted to a video he 
20110114030455.000|20110114030457.000|TR0|posted on YouTube showing the campus, 
20110114030457.000|20110114030459.000|TR0|claiming, "We are examining the torture of 
20110114030459.000|20110114030502.000|TR0|students, and this is my genocide."
20110114030502.000|20110114030504.000|TR0|
20110114030504.000|20110114030506.000|TR0|Loughner was told he could not return to 
20110114030506.000|20110114030508.000|TR0|college without a note from a mental 
20110114030508.000|20110114030511.000|TR0|health professional, the college saying 
20110114030511.000|20110114030513.000|TR0|they have done all they could.
20110114030513.000|20110114030515.000|TR0|
20110114030515.000|20110114030517.000|TR0|But did they?  Take a look.  The Pima 
20110114030517.000|20110114030520.000|TR0|College police chief, Stella Bay, told 
20110114030520.000|20110114030522.000|TR0|"The New York Times" the law could not 
20110114030522.000|20110114030524.000|TR0|initiate an involuntary mental evaluation 
20110114030524.000|20110114030527.000|TR0|of Loughner unless, she said -- quote -- 
20110114030527.000|20110114030529.000|TR0|"He posed an imminent danger.  That's the 
20110114030529.000|20110114030531.000|TR0|only way to do it," she said.     Now, 
20110114030531.000|20110114030533.000|TR0|that's actually not true.  And that's 
20110114030533.000|20110114030536.000|TR0|actually true in many states, but it's 
20110114030536.000|20110114030538.000|TR0|actually not true in Arizona.  Take a 
20110114030538.000|20110114030540.000|TR0|look.  This is Arizona's law on 
20110114030540.000|20110114030542.000|TR0|involuntary commitment.  It applies when 
20110114030542.000|20110114030545.000|TR0|someone is -- quote -- "a danger to 
20110114030545.000|20110114030547.000|TR0|self-or to others," as the campus police 
20110114030547.000|20110114030549.000|TR0|chief said, but she seems to be unaware of 
20110114030549.000|20110114030551.000|TR0|the rest, "is persistently or acutely 
20110114030551.000|20110114030554.000|TR0|disabled or is gravely disabled."
20110114030554.000|20110114030556.000|TR0|
20110114030556.000|20110114030558.000|TR0|It's a much looser standard than imminent 
20110114030558.000|20110114030600.000|TR0|danger.
20110114030600.000|20110114030603.000|TR0|
20110114030603.000|20110114030605.000|TR0|As for what it would take to initiate 
20110114030605.000|20110114030607.000|TR0|commitment proceedings, we spoke to  Neal 
20110114030607.000|20110114030609.000|TR0|Cash, who runs a large nonprofit mental 
20110114030609.000|20110114030612.000|TR0|health provider in Pima County for the 
20110114030612.000|20110114030614.000|TR0|state of Arizona.  He told us there's a 
20110114030614.000|20110114030616.000|TR0|24- hour, seven-day-a-week hot line that 
20110114030616.000|20110114030618.000|TR0|people can call, anyone can, to get the 
20110114030618.000|20110114030621.000|TR0|ball rolling.
20110114030621.000|20110114030623.000|TR0|
20110114030623.000|20110114030625.000|TR0|His organization has a crisis response 
20110114030625.000|20110114030627.000|TR0|team of mental health professionals.  And 
20110114030627.000|20110114030630.000|TR0|if they determine there's an immediate 
20110114030630.000|20110114030632.000|TR0|threat, they will get local police and 
20110114030632.000|20110114030634.000|TR0|legal authorities involved.  Cash says he 
20110114030634.000|20110114030636.000|TR0|doesn't have any record of anyone calling 
20110114030636.000|20110114030639.000|TR0|about Loughner.
20110114030639.000|20110114030641.000|TR0|
20110114030641.000|20110114030643.000|TR0|As for Chief Bay, when we tried to reach 
20110114030643.000|20110114030645.000|TR0|her for comment, her office directed us to 
20110114030645.000|20110114030648.000|TR0|the college administration, who said they 
20110114030648.000|20110114030650.000|TR0|would come on the program tomorrow, but 
20110114030650.000|20110114030652.000|TR0|had no comment until then.
20110114030652.000|20110114030654.000|TR0|
20110114030654.000|20110114030657.000|TR0|Joining us now is Chuck (sic) Arnold.  He 
20110114030657.000|20110114030659.000|TR0|is a lawyer in Arizona specializing in 
20110114030659.000|20110114030701.000|TR0|mental health issues.  He currently serves 
20110114030701.000|20110114030703.000|TR0|on the board of Mental Health America of 
20110114030703.000|20110114030706.000|TR0|Arizona.  Also Brian Van Brunt, president 
20110114030706.000|20110114030708.000|TR0|of the American College Counseling 
20110114030708.000|20110114030710.000|TR0|Association.
20110114030710.000|20110114030712.000|TR0|
20110114030712.000|20110114030715.000|TR0|I appreciate both of you being with -- 
20110114030715.000|20110114030717.000|TR0|with us.
20110114030717.000|20110114030719.000|TR0|
20110114030719.000|20110114030721.000|TR0|Mr. Arnold, obviously, hindsight is 20/20, 
20110114030721.000|20110114030724.000|TR0|and it's very easy to kind of pick -- 
20110114030724.000|20110114030726.000|TR0|cherry-pick things, but you think Jared 
20110114030726.000|20110114030728.000|TR0|Loughner's college could and should have 
20110114030728.000|20110114030730.000|TR0|taken steps to submit him to an 
20110114030730.000|20110114030733.000|TR0|involuntary mental health evaluation.  Why?
20110114030733.000|20110114030735.000|TR0|
20110114030735.000|20110114030737.000|TR0|CHARLES "CHICK" ARNOLD, MENTAL HEALTH 
20110114030737.000|20110114030739.000|TR0|AMERICA OF ARIZONA:  Well, you know, 
20110114030739.000|20110114030742.000|TR0|Anderson, as a practical matter, all 
20110114030742.000|20110114030744.000|TR0|mental health law represents a balance 
20110114030744.000|20110114030746.000|TR0|between individual rights and community 
20110114030746.000|20110114030748.000|TR0|rights.
20110114030748.000|20110114030751.000|TR0|
20110114030751.000|20110114030753.000|TR0|Every one of us has the absolute right to 
20110114030753.000|20110114030755.000|TR0|have a mental illness and remain free from 
20110114030755.000|20110114030758.000|TR0|involuntary treatment.  But when our 
20110114030758.000|20110114030800.000|TR0|community's rights trump that by a 
20110114030800.000|20110114030802.000|TR0|dangerous situation or, according to our 
20110114030802.000|20110114030804.000|TR0|statute, persistent and acute disability, 
20110114030804.000|20110114030807.000|TR0|it's critical that that person be subject 
20110114030807.000|20110114030809.000|TR0|to treatment.
20110114030809.000|20110114030811.000|TR0|
20110114030811.000|20110114030813.000|TR0|Our law has -- has -- is the -- the 
20110114030813.000|20110114030816.000|TR0|product of a long study and many years of 
20110114030816.000|20110114030818.000|TR0|research that essentially wants to get 
20110114030818.000|20110114030820.000|TR0|into a problem before there's a 
20110114030820.000|20110114030822.000|TR0|dangerousness, before it manifests itself 
20110114030822.000|20110114030825.000|TR0|as danger to others or danger to self.
20110114030825.000|20110114030827.000|TR0|
20110114030827.000|20110114030829.000|TR0|COOPER:  Dr. Van Brunt, you disagree.  You 
20110114030829.000|20110114030831.000|TR0|think there -- there wasn't enough 
20110114030831.000|20110114030834.000|TR0|evidence to -- to warrant involuntary 
20110114030834.000|20110114030836.000|TR0|evaluation; is that correct?
20110114030836.000|20110114030838.000|TR0|
20110114030838.000|20110114030840.000|TR0|DR. BRIAN VAN BRUNT, PRESIDENT, AMERICAN 
20110114030840.000|20110114030843.000|TR0|COLLEGE COUNSELING ASSOCIATION:  I think 
20110114030843.000|20110114030845.000|TR0|the case is unfolding now, Anderson, so 
20110114030845.000|20110114030847.000|TR0|we're still taking some information about 
20110114030847.000|20110114030849.000|TR0|that.
20110114030849.000|20110114030852.000|TR0|
20110114030852.000|20110114030854.000|TR0|However, a college student being bizarre 
20110114030854.000|20110114030856.000|TR0|-- I don't know the last time Chuck was on 
20110114030856.000|20110114030858.000|TR0|a college campus, but simply being bizarre 
20110114030858.000|20110114030901.000|TR0|or acting strangely is not enough to 
20110114030901.000|20110114030903.000|TR0|necessitate an involuntary commitment.
20110114030903.000|20110114030905.000|TR0|
20110114030905.000|20110114030907.000|TR0|What we're looking at here is, we would -- 
20110114030907.000|20110114030910.000|TR0|if this was the policy for all campuses, 
20110114030910.000|20110114030912.000|TR0|that we would take anyone who was acting 
20110114030912.000|20110114030914.000|TR0|bizarre or strange, and require a mental 
20110114030914.000|20110114030916.000|TR0|health evaluation, we would have -- we 
20110114030916.000|20110114030919.000|TR0|would essentially turn our community 
20110114030919.000|20110114030921.000|TR0|colleges and residential schools into 
20110114030921.000|20110114030923.000|TR0|inpatient psychiatric facilities.
20110114030923.000|20110114030925.000|TR0|
20110114030925.000|20110114030928.000|TR0|There's a lot of bizarre or strange 
20110114030928.000|20110114030930.000|TR0|behavior.  It's when it crosses over into 
20110114030930.000|20110114030932.000|TR0|threatening other students and becomes 
20110114030932.000|20110114030934.000|TR0|aggressive, that's the point where we need 
20110114030934.000|20110114030937.000|TR0|to take action.
20110114030937.000|20110114030939.000|TR0|
20110114030939.000|20110114030941.000|TR0|COOPER:  But if there's -- and, again, I 
20110114030941.000|20110114030943.000|TR0|don't know the answer to this, but, I 
20110114030943.000|20110114030946.000|TR0|mean, if you have multiple instances where 
20110114030946.000|20110114030948.000|TR0|the police are involved, and you have 
20110114030948.000|20110114030950.000|TR0|students saying and teachers saying, you 
20110114030950.000|20110114030952.000|TR0|know, they feel concerned, wouldn't the 
20110114030952.000|20110114030955.000|TR0|campus police at least, if they knew the 
20110114030955.000|20110114030957.000|TR0|law, you know, make that call?
20110114030957.000|20110114030959.000|TR0|
20110114030959.000|20110114031001.000|TR0|VAN BRUNT:  I think the campus police did 
20110114031001.000|20110114031004.000|TR0|take a step here.  They didn't do nothing 
20110114031004.000|20110114031006.000|TR0|in this case, they took it forward.  They 
20110114031006.000|20110114031008.000|TR0|actually separated him from the college 
20110114031008.000|20110114031010.000|TR0|through their campus behavioral 
20110114031010.000|20110114031013.000|TR0|intervention team, which is a standard 
20110114031013.000|20110114031015.000|TR0|practice.
20110114031015.000|20110114031017.000|TR0|
20110114031017.000|20110114031019.000|TR0|They moved forward with the case.  They 
20110114031019.000|20110114031022.000|TR0|went so far as to take a 22-year-old's 
20110114031022.000|20110114031024.000|TR0|rights away and notify the parents.  They 
20110114031024.000|20110114031026.000|TR0|talked directly to the parents about the 
20110114031026.000|20110114031028.000|TR0|situation and moved forward on it, and 
20110114031028.000|20110114031031.000|TR0|went another step forward, saying, before 
20110114031031.000|20110114031033.000|TR0|you come back to our community, you need 
20110114031033.000|20110114031035.000|TR0|to have a mental health evaluation.

20110114033016.000|20110114033018.000|TR0|RANDI KAYE, CNN CORRESPONDENT 
20110114033018.000|20110114033021.000|TR0|(voice-over):  In the months before the 
20110114033021.000|20110114033023.000|TR0|shooting, Jared Loughner appears 
20110114033023.000|20110114033025.000|TR0|especially disturbed.  His world was 
20110114033025.000|20110114033027.000|TR0|getting darker, his questions stranger.
20110114033027.000|20110114033030.000|TR0|
20110114033030.000|20110114033032.000|TR0|(on camera):  Chat room postings published 
20110114033032.000|20110114033034.000|TR0|by "The Wall Street Journal" offer insight 
20110114033034.000|20110114033036.000|TR0|into Loughner's growing disappointment and 
20110114033036.000|20110114033039.000|TR0|resentment, a window into his state of 
20110114033039.000|20110114033041.000|TR0|mind.  "The Journal" says Loughner, using 
20110114033041.000|20110114033043.000|TR0|a pseudonym, posted more than 130 messages 
20110114033043.000|20110114033045.000|TR0|last spring over a two-month period on an 
20110114033045.000|20110114033048.000|TR0|online gaming forum.  He seemed to be 
20110114033048.000|20110114033050.000|TR0|dealing with feelings of rejection and 
20110114033050.000|20110114033052.000|TR0|searching for a purpose.
20110114033052.000|20110114033054.000|TR0|
20110114033054.000|20110114033057.000|TR0|(voice-over):  CNN hasn't been able to 
20110114033057.000|20110114033059.000|TR0|confirm independently the postings are 
20110114033059.000|20110114033101.000|TR0|Loughner's, but they're filled with 
20110114033101.000|20110114033103.000|TR0|aggression, many of them too startling to 
20110114033103.000|20110114033106.000|TR0|comprehend.
20110114033106.000|20110114033108.000|TR0|
20110114033108.000|20110114033110.000|TR0|April 24 last year, he asked: "Would you 
20110114033110.000|20110114033112.000|TR0|hit a handicapped child/adult?"
20110114033112.000|20110114033115.000|TR0|
20110114033115.000|20110114033117.000|TR0|Later that same day, a hate-filled rant 
20110114033117.000|20110114033119.000|TR0|titled "Why rape," suggesting college 
20110114033119.000|20110114033122.000|TR0|women enjoyed rape.  "There are rape 
20110114033122.000|20110114033124.000|TR0|victims that are under the influence of a 
20110114033124.000|20110114033126.000|TR0|substance.  The drinking is leading them 
20110114033126.000|20110114033128.000|TR0|to rape.  Being alone for a very long time 
20110114033128.000|20110114033131.000|TR0|will inevitably lead you to rape."
20110114033131.000|20110114033133.000|TR0|
20110114033133.000|20110114033135.000|TR0|May 9, he asked, "Does anyone have 
20110114033135.000|20110114033137.000|TR0|aggression 24/7?"
20110114033137.000|20110114033140.000|TR0|
20110114033140.000|20110114033142.000|TR0|The next night, a new online thread: "If 
20110114033142.000|20110114033144.000|TR0|you went to prison right now, what would 
20110114033144.000|20110114033146.000|TR0|you be thinking?"  He added, "Just 
20110114033146.000|20110114033149.000|TR0|curious."
20110114033149.000|20110114033151.000|TR0|
20110114033151.000|20110114033153.000|TR0|May 20, he wrote, "I bet you're hungry, 
20110114033153.000|20110114033155.000|TR0|because I know how to cut a body open and 
20110114033155.000|20110114033158.000|TR0|eat you for more than a week."
20110114033158.000|20110114033200.000|TR0|
20110114033200.000|20110114033202.000|TR0|If Loughner was looking to escape his 
20110114033202.000|20110114033204.000|TR0|demons, and reality, too, he may have done 
20110114033204.000|20110114033207.000|TR0|so through something called lucid 
20110114033207.000|20110114033209.000|TR0|dreaming, an alternative reality in which 
20110114033209.000|20110114033211.000|TR0|a person is aware he's in a dream and can 
20110114033211.000|20110114033213.000|TR0|manipulate that dream.       Psychology

20110114033234.000|20110114033236.000|TR0|very dangerous, especially if they were

20110114035703.000|20110114035705.000|TR0|very hard on this.
20110114035705.000|20110114035707.000|TR0|
20110114035707.000|20110114035710.000|TR0|But it's on the "RidicuList" tonight 
20110114035710.000|20110114035712.000|TR0|because of this line from chapter five, 
20110114035712.000|20110114035714.000|TR0|page 139.  Quote, "Journalists encourage 
20110114035714.000|20110114035717.000|TR0|state and local officials and residents to 
20110114035717.000|20110114035719.000|TR0|display their anger at the federal 
20110114035719.000|20110114035721.000|TR0|response and offered coverage when they 
20110114035721.000|20110114035723.000|TR0|did.  Anderson Cooper reportedly asked a 
20110114035723.000|20110114035726.000|TR0|parish president to bring an angry, 
20110114035726.000|20110114035728.000|TR0|unemployed offshore oil worker on his 
20110114035728.000|20110114035730.000|TR0|show.  When the parish president could not 
20110114035730.000|20110114035732.000|TR0|promise the worker would be angry, both 
20110114035732.000|20110114035735.000|TR0|were disinvited."
20110114035735.000|20110114035737.000|TR0|
20110114035737.000|20110114035739.000|TR0|Well, here's my report on that.  Guess 
20110114035739.000|20110114035741.000|TR0|what?  It's not going to take six months 
20110114035741.000|20110114035744.000|TR0|and almost 400 pages to say what I have to 
20110114035744.000|20110114035746.000|TR0|say.
20110114035746.000|20110114035748.000|TR0|
20110114035748.000|20110114035750.000|TR0|That statement is 100 percent, without a 
20110114035750.000|20110114035753.000|TR0|doubt, completely untrue.  Just wrong.  
20110114035753.000|20110114035755.000|TR0|False.  First of all, I don't book guests, 
20110114035755.000|20110114035757.000|TR0|and in the two months that I was in New 
20110114035757.000|20110114035759.000|TR0|Orleans covering the BP disaster, I never 
20110114035759.000|20110114035802.000|TR0|called up a parish president or ran into 
20110114035802.000|20110114035804.000|TR0|one and asked them to be on my show or to 
20110114035804.000|20110114035806.000|TR0|find someone for me.  It just never 
20110114035806.000|20110114035808.000|TR0|happened.  I never did that.
20110114035808.000|20110114035811.000|TR0|
20110114035811.000|20110114035813.000|TR0|You'll notice the government report says I 
20110114035813.000|20110114035815.000|TR0|reportedly asked a parish president.  That 
20110114035815.000|20110114035817.000|TR0|means someone told them that.  No name, so 
20110114035817.000|20110114035820.000|TR0|it's hard to know how to respond more 
20110114035820.000|20110114035822.000|TR0|directly.  But I'm telling you, it didn't 
20110114035822.000|20110114035824.000|TR0|happen.
20110114035824.000|20110114035826.000|TR0|
20110114035826.000|20110114035829.000|TR0|Second, no one on my staff would demand 
20110114035829.000|20110114035831.000|TR0|that a guest be, quote, unquote, "angry."  
20110114035831.000|20110114035833.000|TR0|And then disinvite someone else because 
20110114035833.000|20110114035835.000|TR0|they couldn't guarantee they could find a, 
20110114035835.000|20110114035838.000|TR0|quote, unquote, "angry person." We just 
20110114035838.000|20110114035840.000|TR0|don't work that way.  We book people and 
20110114035840.000|20110114035842.000|TR0|sometimes have to cancel them for all 
20110114035842.000|20110114035844.000|TR0|sorts of reasons -- timing, scheduling, we 
20110114035844.000|20110114035847.000|TR0|change topics, the show changes direction 
20110114035847.000|20110114035849.000|TR0|-- but failure to find an angry person is 
20110114035849.000|20110114035851.000|TR0|not one of them.
20110114035851.000|20110114035853.000|TR0|
20110114035853.000|20110114035856.000|TR0|And third, the idea that journalists were 
20110114035856.000|20110114035858.000|TR0|manufacturing the anger and frustration

20110114035900.000|20110114035902.000|TR0|local officials is preposterous.  I can't 
20110114035902.000|20110114035905.000|TR0|speak for all journalists, but the idea

20110114035907.000|20110114035909.000|TR0|reasons for people in the Gulf to be upset 
20110114035909.000|20110114035911.000|TR0|about the response to the spill is just

20110114035916.000|20110114035918.000|TR0|report, at least that part of it, on 
20110114035918.000|20110114035920.000|TR0|tonight's "RidicuList."
